name: conservancy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] an area of land kept in its natural state, especially for wild animals and plants to live in and be protected: He created the 25 million-acre Sierra Nevada Conservancy, the biggest nature conservancy in the state.
[ C or U ] an organization whose aim is to protect natural areas or interesting and important places, and the animals and plants living in them: Since it formed in 1980, the conservancy has raised $300 million for a range of improvements to the park.
[ U ] the protection of plants and animals, natural areas, and interesting and important structures and buildings, especially from the damaging effects of human activity: He promotes healthy living and conservancy of the ocean.
More examplesFewer examples Tompkins originally planned to use the land to create a nature conservancy run by Chileans. The John Muir Trust is a conservancy body named for the Scottish-born patron of national parks like Yellowstone and Yosemite in the United States.The American Bird Conservancy will give a $104,000 grant.Many water conservancy projects have also been completed in various rural areas.
